isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - CAB: 5000, 9100, 9200, 9300, 9400 - REMOVE AND INSTALL - WIPER PIVOT WITH ELECTRIC HEADER MOUNTED WIPERS

svcproc.title: WIPER PIVOT WITH ELECTRIC HEADER MOUNTED WIPERS

svcsubproc.title: Remove
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 100 for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. WIPER ON/OFF AND HI/LO SPEED CONTROL; THREE POSITION ROCKER SWITCH
3. INTERMITTENT WIPER CONTROL/WASHER ACTUATION SLIDE SWITCH

step1.para: Disconnect the battery ground cable.
Remove the 6 mounting screws (Item 4) from the cab header panel (Item 7) and lower the windshield wiper/washer control panel (Item 6).

Pull the wiper/washer control panel (Item 6) down to gain access to the back of the control panel. Disconnect electrical connections to the wiper on/off control switch (Item 1), intermittent wiper control/washer switch (Item 3) and indicator lights (Item 2). Place the wiper/washer control panel out of the way.
Remove the radio, if so equipped. Refer to GROUP 08 - ELECTRICAL in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual and the manufacturer's recommended instructions.

Remove the 6 mounting screws ( Item 18, Figure 101) from the passenger side (right) access cover panel ( Item 5, Figure 101) and remove it from the cab header ( Item 9, Figure 101). Use the following procedure to remove the driver and passenger side wiper pivots.

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. SHORTER WIPER LINKAGE SHIELD, RIGHT SIDE
7. WIPER/WASHER CONTROL PANEL ACCESS DRIVER SIDE (LEFT) (FOR REFERENCE ONLY)
8. LONGER WIPER LINKAGE SHIELD, LEFT SIDE
11. THREADED END OF WIPER PIVOT (FOR REFERENCE ONLY)
12. THREADED SPACER (FURNISHED WITH WIPER PIVOT AND BRACKET ASSEMBLY)
14. CASTELLATED CAPSCREW 240 TO 265 IN-LBS. (27 TO 30 NM)
18. ACCESS PANEL MOUNTING SCREWS 10 IN-LBS. (1.2 NM)
5. THREADED SPACER 40 TO 50 IN-LBS. (4.5 TO 5.6 NM)

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 102 for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para: Remove the clip and washer (Item 9) holding the wiper linkage (Items 4 and 7) to the wiper pivot (Item 2).
Remove the wiper linkage shields (Items 3 and 8) by removing pan head screws (Item 10) that attach them to the wiper pivot and bracket assembly (Item 1).
Disconnect the washer hose ( Item 1, Figure 98) at the fitting ( Item 2, Figure 98) on the cab roof.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 99 for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para: Remove the acorn nut and lockwasher (Items 1 and 2) securing the wiper arm and blade (Item 9) to the knurled driver (Item 8) on the wiper pivot (Item 3). Remove the wiper arm and blade.

caution.para: Do not pound on or pry the wiper arm. Use an appropriate puller to remove it.

step1.para: Remove the knurled driver, weather seal, hex nut, flat washer and gasket washer (Items 8, 7, 6, 5, 4) from the wiper pivot (Item 3).

From inside the cab, remove the pan head screws ( Item 5, Figure 100) fastening the wiper pivot and bracket assembly ( Item 1, Figure 102) to the bottom of the header, then remove the wiper pivot and bracket assembly. Note the location of the threaded spacer ( Item 5, Figure 102) on the pivot shaft ( Item 6, Figure 102) inside the roof.

Put the threaded spacer onto the pivot shaft and tighten to 40 to 50 in-lbs. (4.5 to 5.6 Nm). Then install the wiper pivot and bracket assembly and secure it with the pan head screws to the bottom of the header. Tighten to 10 in-lbs. (1.2 Nm).
Install the gasket washer, flat washer and hex nut and tighten to 144 to 180 in-lbs. (16.2 to 20.3 Nm). Install the weather seal and the knurled driver on the wiper pivot.

Position wiper arm and blade at knurled driver on wiper pivot so the park position of the wiper blade pivot, the point at which the dimension is measured, is 1.5 inches (38 mm) below the weather seal and push the wiper arm onto the knurled driver.
Install the lockwasher and acorn nut. Tighten to 54 to 62 in-lbs. (6 to 7 Nm).
Connect the washer hose to the fitting on the cab roof.
Install the wiper linkage shields to the wiper pivot and bracket assembly with the pan head screws. Tighten to 10 in-lbs. (1.2 Nm).
Install and secure the wiper linkage to the wiper pivot and bracket assembly with the clip and washer.
Position the passenger side (right) wiper access cover panel on the cab header and install the 6 mounting screws. Tighten to 10 in-lbs. (1.2 Nm).

Position the wiper/washer control panel driver side (left) at the header panel. Reconnect the electrical connections to the wiper on/off control switch, intermittent wiper control/washer switch and indicator lights.
Place the windshield wiper/washer control panel on the cab header panel, making sure the connecting wires are not pinched. Secure it with the 6 mounting screws. Tighten to 10 in-lbs. (1.2 Nm).
Replace the radio, if so equipped. Refer to GROUP 08 - ELECTRICAL in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual and the manufacturer's instructions.
Reconnect the battery ground cable.
Check the wipers for correct operation.
